intro: Phyllanthus skutchii, commonly known as the Skutch's phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with diverse morphological characteristics. The plant typically grows as a shrub with simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Phyllanthus skutchii is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
